verses.text: "Every word of God is flawless; he is a shield to those who take refuge in him.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:5–6
rsbNotes.text: 30:5, 6 With these words Agur gives an assessment of God’s Word within the framework of Israel’s law and prophetic writings. He quotes Ps. 18:30 and echoes Deut. 4:2. The full knowledge of God comes through special revelation and is received by faith (1:7 note).

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:5
rsbNotes.text: 30:5 proves true. That is, tried and found to be utterly reliable.

verses.text: Do not add to his words, or he will rebuke you and prove you a liar.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:6
rsbNotes.text: 30:6 Do not add to his words. To add to God’s words is to sit in judgment on them and to find them wanting by human standards. This shifts the basis of knowledge and truth from God to ourselves. This pride of the creature is a mainspring of sin (Gen. 2:9 note).
